result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mervin W. Bibbey

records.addlTxt: for dismissal of DA
for dismissal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Payment (repayment to the county) of Dean Attorney Fees  ($1878 dean fees owed to county per this order; def also owes extradition reimbursement to Richland County with that cost ordered as part of the diversion agreement)
Petition and Order for Payment of Dean Attorney Fees (submitted to Accts. Payable 8/3/16; def to be ordered to fully reimburse Richland County)

Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey appeared via skype from California on computer presented to the court by Attorney Peter K. Lawrence who appeared in court on his behalf.  Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin, for ADA Amy Forehand. Court's colloquy with def re right to appear in person for plea.  Def states he understands that right and waives it.  

This matter was on the calendar today as "status."  Atty. L informs the Court that the parties have reached an agreement that will resolve this case short of trial.  Per Atty. L, the parties are proposing a diversion agreement whereby def will plead to counts 1-4; counts 5 and 6 will be read-in and def to be on the d.a. with the DA for 5 years; terms of the agreement require lump sum payment towards arrears within time limit set in the agreement; additionally, def to remain current on support benefits and to work towards apportionment of disability benefits; in meantime, def to make the support payments himself.

Def pleads no contest to counts 1-4.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Judgment withheld for 5-year diversion agreement.  Counts 5 and 6 dismissed and read-in.

Atty. Lawrence notes that he was Court-appointment as Dean counsel in this case.  Def to repay Richland County at rate of $50/mo with first payment due by 5/1/16.

Court notes it has not received the diversion agreement in its entirety; will sign it once the full agreement is received by the Court.
Status conference on April 7, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court for Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey.  This is status as to whether this matter is going to trial.  DA Harper states this is ADA Forehand's case.  Atty. Lawrence provides status update - states there is still a large arrearage amount but def is not able to make a large lump sum payment towards that balance.  Matter remains on for trial.  Court states that, after today, it will not honor any plea agreements.  Trial is on the calendar for April 18 and 19.  Final pretrial is April 15th at 2.  Def is required to appear 4/15 at 2.  DA states ADA's offer to Def was for payment or plea.  Court gives defense til April 7th at 9:45 for the "final, final status."  If defendant is planning to plea, he must be here in person or by video as long as the video can be set up and tested.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Status conference at 03-30-2016 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial at 04-15-2016 02:00 pm.
Jury trial at 04-18-2016 08:30 am.
Status conference at 03-30-2016 11:00 am

Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court for Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey.  Matter not resolved.  ADA requests trial - 2 days.  April 18 and 19 for jury trial; April 15 at 2 for final pretrial - def to appear in person; final status/trial going yes/no - March 30 at 11.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference at 01-13-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey not in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court for Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey.  Atty. L appears for def; states def is in California.  Counsel note def posted large sum towards the arrears and is working to do that again; request further status in January.  Atty. L states that next date may be a plea; inquires about possibility of that by video.  Court - that is only possible if the video works.  Status set for 9 a.m. Jan. 13.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference at 09-30-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court for Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey.  Atty. L states def did make the payment that was referred to at earlier hearing; asks for one more setover to plea date; def still in California and could appear by videoconferencing.  Court states that is permissible if def waives right to be here in person.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 08-05-2015 09:00 am

Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court for Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey appeared by phone means from California.  Atty. L reports on status of this matter; refers to recent order calling for payment of support from trust account presently being held by out-of-state counsel.  Atty. L states counsel have a proposed resolution; he wants to confer with Def re that; has questions for about apportionment.  Adj. to August 5 requested.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
disbursing funds from trust account.
from Atty. Lawrence, informing the ADA and clerk that def has deposited funds into Atty. Turer's Trust Account
Prohibiting Disbursement of Funds from Trust Account (to be forwarded by Atty. Lawrence to California)

Case called today at request of Atty. Lawrence.  Appearances by ADA Forehand for the State and by Atty. Lawrence for the Defense.  Atty. L notes that def doesn't appear because he resides in CA and wasn't aware that this was going to be called; normally, def would appear by phone.  Atty. L states he's talked with atty's office in CA and learned details of how money is about to be deposited there; money is relevant to resolution of this matter; asks that this Court make an order that the money be deposited in the atty's trust account and not disbursed until further order of this Court.  Court is not aware of any interstate compact that would allow for this request; willing to make an order as requested but not sure how effective that order will be.  Atty. L states the money would pay back about 2/3 of the benefits owed to the mother.  Court will sign the order.  ADA does not object.

Amended: Once the $20,000 has been deposited into the attorney trust account, it is to remain there until this case is disposed.

All other conditions still apply.
Original bond mailed to def. He is to sign and mail back within 10 days.

Amended ** Once the $20,000 has been deposited into the attorney trust account, it is to remain there until this case is disposed.

All other conditions still apply.
Status conference at 06-17-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey appeared by phone means. Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court for Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey.  Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty L. gives status of case, requests 45 day setover. DA does not object to setting this matter over again, however, moves to amend the bond so that the defendant be prohibited from disbursing any of the funds until the case is resolved. Comment by Atty L. Def is to sign his bond (mailed by the clerk) and within 10 days.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Status conference at 03-30-2015 03:15 pm
Atty. Lawrence has requested an adjournment of the 3/18/15 status; DA does not object.
Atty. L's letter to the clerk and court re def's phone appearance request
Status conference at 03-18-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Peter K. Lawrence not in court; had advised the Court via email earlier today that he could not make the appearance and had instructed def to make his appearance by phone.  Court asks ADA for report on status of the case.  ADA states that Atty. L was pursuing seized money in California that would cover the arrears in this case; has not heard from Atty. L on his progress in that attempt.  Def states he thought the money was going to be released on the 22nd of this month but the DA in that matter asks for further adjournment of the matter (California matter).  Matter adj. to March 18th at 10.  Court states that, if def wants to appear by phone, his attorney shall notify the Court of that.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference at 01-28-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court for Defendant Mervin W. Bibbey. Atty. L states that def has matter in California that's in the process of being resolved; states def will be receiving $ that will be used for most, if not all, of his arrearage ($22k arrearage and $3k interest presently due).  Atty. L asks for status in this matter.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Atty. L has asked that def again be allowed to appear by phone at next appearance.  Court so orders.

ADDRESS INFO for Mervin W. Bibbey
Current: 490 Citrus Ave, Imperial Beach, CA 91932 United States  (Effective: 10-15-2014)
Prior: 490 Citrus Ave., Imperial Beach, CA 91932 United States
Adjourned initial appearance on December 3, 2014 at 11:00 am.

ADA Forehand and Def without counsel.  Def states he gets disability and doesn't qualify for SPD.  Court considers appointment of Dean counsel.  Clerk notes that def has outstanding balance and has had ftp warrants for not paying in other matters.  Court proceeds with court appointment - appoints Atty. Peter Lawrence, requiring def to repay Richland County for the costs of counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 12-03-2014 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mervin W. Bibbey
Current: 490 Citrus Ave., Imperial Beach, CA 91932 United States  (Effective: 09-05-2014)
Prior: 490 Citrus Ave., Imperial Beach, CA 91932 United States
Notice of Hearing - Return to sender not deliverable as addressed - remailed

ADDRESS INFO for Mervin W. Bibbey
Current: 490 Citrus Ave., Imperial Beach, CA 91932 United States  (Effective: 09-02-2014)
Prior: 13405 County Highway D, La Farge, WI 54639

Court orders that Defendant pay his child support.  Def not to have any contact with Bonnie Bennett or her residence - no contact whatsoever including no contact with her residence, place of work, or any other place where she temporary resides.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 15, 2014 at 11:00 am.

DA Harper for the State; Def in custody, appearing via video from the Richland County Jail, with Atty. L McDougal representing him (appearing via phone).  This is an initial appearance following def's arrest on the complaint in this case.  DA asks for bond to be set at 5k signature bond with condition that def pay his child support.  DA also asks for no contact with BB or her residence, her job or any other place where she is at any given time.  BB addresses the Court.  Court orders bond as requested.

Atty. McDougal states that this is her only appearance in this matter as def doesn't qualify.

Initial adj. to Oct. 15 at 11.  

Court has advised def of right to counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 10-15-2014 at 11:00 am.
per dispo sheet from RCSD - def was arrested by Customs & Border Protection and will be transported to/housed in the San Diego Co. Jail; will eventually be brought to Richland County on extradition
